name: Cahinca
Relationship: Compare: Apocyn.; Ars.; Coffea (similar botanically and in relieving effects of fatigue).

Urine: Burning pain in urethra, especially glandular portion
Back: Pain in region of kidneys; better lying bent backward
Male: Pain worse during passage of pungent smelling urine
Drawing in of testicles and spermatic cord

details: This remedy has been found of use in dropsical affections. Its urinary symptoms are well marked. Albuminuria, with dyspnoea on lying down at night. Ascites and anasarca, with dry skin.
